com.example.stanza

Class FriendBoardFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.stanza.FriendBoardFragment

  • public class FriendBoardFragment
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing the Friends Board fragment, which contains a list of the user's friend's poems. Appears under the "Friends Board" tab in the dashboard page.

    • Method Detail

      • onCreateView

        @Nullable
public View onCreateView(LayoutInflater inflater,
                                    ViewGroup container,
                                    Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Called to have the Friends Board fragment instantiate its user interface view.
        Parameters:
        inflater - The LayoutInflater object that can be used to inflate any views in the fragment.
        container - The parent view that the Friends Board fragment's UI should be attached to.
        savedInstanceState - If non-null, this fragment is being re-constructed from a previous saved state as given here.
        Returns:
        The View for the Friend Board Fragment's UI.

        public void onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu menu,

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(MenuItem item)

      • onActivityCreated

        public void onActivityCreated(@Nullable
                              Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Called when MainActivity has been created and the Friends Board fragment's view hierarchy has been instantiated.
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - If the fragment is being re-created from a previous saved state, this is the state.

      • pullPoems

        public void pullPoems()
        Runs a CommThread, which retrieves the User's Friends' Poems from the Backend server.

      • addFriend

        public void addFriend(java.lang.String username)

      • onCreateLoader

        public android.support.v4.content.Loader<Cursor> onCreateLoader(int id,
                                                                Bundle args)
        Instantiate and return a new Loader for user's friends' poems in the database.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID whose loader is to be created.
        args - Any arguments supplied by the caller.
        Returns:
        A new Loader instance that is ready to start loading.

      • onLoadFinished

        public void onLoadFinished(android.support.v4.content.Loader<Cursor> loader,
                           Cursor data)
        Called when a previously created loader has finished its load. Provides PoemRecyclerAdapter with the data generated by the loader.
        Parameters:
        loader - The Loader that has finished.
        data - The data generated by the Loader.

      • onLoaderReset

        public void onLoaderReset(android.support.v4.content.Loader<Cursor> loader)
        Called when a previously created loader is being reset, and thus making its data unavailable. Removes references to the Loader's data within PoemRecyclerAdapter.
        Parameters:
        loader - The Loader that is being reset.

      • onResume

        public void onResume()
        Called when the Friends Board fragment is visible to the user and actively running. Restarts the Loader for the user's friend's poems.

      • poemSaved

        public void poemSaved(java.lang.String output)
        Called when a poem is saved to the remote server. The Friends Board does not allow you to save poems to the server, so this callback is left blank here.
        Parameters:
        output - The output message from CommThread.

      • serverDisconnected

        public void serverDisconnected()
        Called from CommThread if the server is disconnected. Informs the user that the server is not connected, and so cannot retrieve friends' poems from the backend server.

      • onPullFinished

        public void onPullFinished()
        Called when the app has finished retrieving the user's friends' poems. Stops the refreshing UI indicator and restarts the Loader.

      • onServerDisconnected

        public void onServerDisconnected()

      • onLoginSuccess

        public void onLoginSuccess()

      • onLoginFailed

        public void onLoginFailed(java.lang.String error_message)
